intro: Smilax china f. xanthocarpa, commonly known as the yellow-fruited smilax, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Araceae. It is characterized by its climbing habit, with thorned stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers, followed by yellow berries that are edible but have a bitter taste. It is native to regions of East Asia, including China, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
